sofya.ed.semantic
Class InstrumentationManager.ErrorHandler

java.lang.Object
  sofya.ed.semantic.InstrumentationManager.ErrorHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
InstrumentationManager.DetachingErrorHandler, InstrumentationManager.HaltingErrorHandler, InstrumentationManager.ResumingErrorHandler
Enclosing class:
InstrumentationManager
public abstract static class InstrumentationManager.ErrorHandler
extends java.lang.Object

An error handler is invoked if an exception is raised while trying to execute an instrumentation update request.

An asynchronous dispatch model is used to execute update requests (even those that are synchronous with respect to the progress of the target program), so a callback to an error handler is necessary to support proper exception handling.

By default, exception information is logged to System.err.

          Target stream to which exception information will be logged.

logError

protected void logError(java.lang.Throwable err,
                        java.lang.Thread t,
                        InstrumentationManager instManager)
Utility method to record the affected thread's information and stack trace to the log stream.

Parameters:
err - Exception that caused the error handler to be invoked.
t - Call dispatch thread in which the exception occurred.
instManager - Instrumentation manager controlling the thread in which the exception occurred.

handleError

protected abstract void handleError(java.lang.Throwable err,
                                    java.lang.Thread t,
                                    InstrumentationManager instManager)
Implements the behavior for handling the error.

Parameters:
err - Exception that caused the error handler to be invoked.
t - Call dispatch thread in which the exception occurred.
instManager - Instrumentation manager controlling the thread in which the exception occurred.

adviseResume

protected abstract boolean adviseResume()
Advises the dispatch thread whether it should attempt to resume the event dispatcher.

Returns:
true if the call dispatch thread should issue a signal to the event dispatcher to attempt to resume, false otherwise.
